trans-unit.source: Project: Musical instrument
trans-unit.target: Project: Musical instrument

trans-unit.source: This is a project in which students are challenged to create a musical instrument that uses arrays to store sequences of notes.
trans-unit.target: This is a project in which students are challenged to create a musical instrument that uses arrays to store sequences of notes.

trans-unit.source: The array of notes can be played when an input occurs, such as one of the buttons being pressed, or if one or more of the pins is activated.
trans-unit.target: The array of notes can be played when an input occurs, such as one of the buttons being pressed, or if one or more of the pins is activated.

trans-unit.source: Ideally, the micro:bit should be mounted in some kind of housing, perhaps a guitar shape or a music box.
trans-unit.target: Ideally, the micro:bit should be mounted in some kind of housing, perhaps a guitar shape or a music box.

trans-unit.source: Start by looking at different kinds of musical instruments to get a sense of what kind of shape you might want to build around your micro:bit.
trans-unit.target: Start by looking at different kinds of musical instruments to get a sense of what kind of shape you might want to build around your micro:bit.

trans-unit.source: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/microbit-guitar.png
trans-unit.target: /static/courses/csintro/arrays/microbit-guitar.png

trans-unit.source: micro:bit guitar
trans-unit.target: micro:bit guitar

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples of guitars that were made out of cardboard and colored, patterned duct tape that you can buy in craft stores.
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples of guitars that were made out of cardboard and colored, patterned duct tape that you can buy in craft stores.

trans-unit.source: Example guitar code
trans-unit.target: Example guitar code

trans-unit.source: This is an example of a project that uses the micro:bit accelerometer to play different tones when the guitar is held and tilted while playing.
trans-unit.target: This is an example of a project that uses the micro:bit accelerometer to play different tones when the guitar is held and tilted while playing.

trans-unit.source: Pressing the A button will save the current tone to an array.
trans-unit.target: Pressing Aボタン will save the current tone to 配列.

trans-unit.source: After ten tones, a repeating melody will be performed.
trans-unit.target: After ten tones, a repeating melody will be performed.

trans-unit.source: Press the B button to clear the array and start over.
trans-unit.target: Press Bボタン to clear 配列 and start over.

trans-unit.source: Song-maker
trans-unit.target: Song-maker

trans-unit.source: Using arrays with musical notes
trans-unit.target: Using arrays with musical notes

trans-unit.source: You can create an array of notes by attaching Music blocks to an array.
trans-unit.target: You can create 配列 of notes by attaching 音楽ブロック to 配列.

trans-unit.source: Musical notes are described in words (e.g., Middle C, High C) but they are actually numbers.
trans-unit.target: Musical notes are described in words (e.g., Middle C, High C) but they are actually numbers.

trans-unit.source: You can do Math operations on those numbers to change the pitch of your song.
trans-unit.target: You can do Math operations on those numbers to change the pitch of your song.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of how to create an array with musical notes.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of how to create 配列 with musical notes.

trans-unit.source: Button A plays every note in the array.
trans-unit.target: Button A plays every note in 配列.

trans-unit.source: Button B plays the notes at twice the frequency (but doesn't alter the original notes.)
trans-unit.target: Button B plays the notes at twice the frequency (but doesn't alter the original notes.)

trans-unit.source: Remember that a 'for element value of list' loop makes a temporary copy of the value, so even if you change a value, it will not change the original element in the array.
trans-unit.target: Remember that a 「配列の値を変数に入れてくりかえす（for element value of list）」 loop makes a temporary copy of the value, so even if you change a value, it will not change the original element in 配列.

trans-unit.source: If students want to permanently change the values in their array (transpose music to increasingly higher keys, for example) they can use a for loop like this:
trans-unit.target: If students want to permanently change the values in their array (transpose music to increasingly higher keys, for example) they can use a for loop like this:

trans-unit.source: Reflection
trans-unit.target: Reflection

trans-unit.source: Have students write a reflection of about 150–300 words, addressing the following points:
trans-unit.target: Have students write a reflection of about 150–300 words, addressing the following points:

trans-unit.source: Explain how you decided on your musical instrument. What brainstorming ideas did you come up with?
trans-unit.target: Explain how you decided on your musical instrument. What brainstorming ideas did you come up with?

trans-unit.source: What properties does it share with a real musical instrument? What is unique?
trans-unit.target: What properties does it share with a real musical instrument? What is unique?

trans-unit.source: Describe the type of array you used (Numbers, Strings, or Notes) and how it functions in your project.
trans-unit.target: Describe the type of array you used (Numbers, Strings, or Notes) and how it functions in your project.

trans-unit.source: What was something that was surprising to you about the process of creating this program?
trans-unit.target: What was something that was surprising to you about the process of creating this program?

trans-unit.source: Describe a difficult point in the process of designing this program, and explain how you resolved it.
trans-unit.target: Describe a difficult point in the process of designing this program, and explain how you resolved it.

trans-unit.source: What feedback did your beta testers give you? How did that help you improve your musical instrument?
trans-unit.target: What feedback did your beta testers give you? How did that help you improve your musical instrument?

trans-unit.source: Assessment
trans-unit.target: 評価

trans-unit.source: Competency scores: 4, 3, 2, 1
trans-unit.target: Competency scores: 4, 3, 2, 1

trans-unit.source: Array
trans-unit.target: Array

trans-unit.source:
4 = Stores and iterates through each element of the array successfully.
3 = Stores each element of the array successfully.
2 = Array skips values or has other problems with storing and/or retrieving elements.
1 = Array doesn't work at all or no array present.
trans-unit.target:
4 = Stores and iterates through each element of 配列 successfully.
3 = Stores each element of 配列 successfully.
2 = Array skips values or has other problems with storing and/or retrieving elements.
1 = Array doesn't work at all or no array present.

trans-unit.source: Maker component
trans-unit.target: Maker component

trans-unit.source:
4 = Tangible component is tightly integrated with the micro:bit and each relies heavily on the other to make the project complete.
3 = Tangible component is somewhat integrated with the micro:bit but is not essential.
2 = Tangible component does not add to the functionality of the program.
1 = No tangible component.
trans-unit.target:
4 = Tangible component is tightly integrated with the micro:bit and each relies heavily on the other to make the project complete.
3 = Tangible component is somewhat integrated with the micro:bit but is not essential.
2 = Tangible component does not add to the functionality of the program.
1 = No tangible component.

trans-unit.source: micro:bit program
trans-unit.target: micro:bit プログラム

trans-unit.source:
4 = The program:
* Uses at least one array in a fully integrated and meaningful way
* Compiles and runs as intended
* Meaningful comments in code
3 = Uses an array in a tangential way that is peripheral to function of project and/or program lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = Array is poorly implemented and/or peripheral to function of project, and/or lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = micro:bit program lacks 3 or more of the required elements.
trans-unit.target:
4 = The program:
* Uses at least one array in a fully integrated and meaningful way
* Compiles and runs as intended
* Meaningful comments in code
3 = Uses an array in a tangential way that is peripheral to function of project and/or program lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = Array is poorly implemented and/or peripheral to function of project, and/or lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = micro:bit program lacks 3 or more of the required elements.

trans-unit.source: Collaboration reflection
trans-unit.target: 共同作業と内省

trans-unit.source:
4 = Reflection piece addresses all prompts.
3 = Reflection piece lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = Reflection piece lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = Reflection piece lacks 3 of the required elements.
trans-unit.target:
4 = Reflection piece addresses all prompts.
3 = Reflection piece lacks 1 of the required elements.
2 = Reflection piece lacks 2 of the required elements.
1 = Reflection piece lacks 3 of the required elements.
